a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Share of students in top PISA mathematics score level, male vs.
Percentage of 15-year-old male and female students scoring higher than 669 on the PISA mathematics scale (i.e. scoring at
level 6). For reference, the metric for the overall mathematics scale is based on a mean for OECD countries of 500 points and a
PISA: Female 15-year-olds by mathematics proficiency level (%). Level 6
PISA: Male 15-year-olds by mathematics proficiency level
Data source: OECD Programme for International Student Assessment (PISA)
